RFM69Serial.device¶

Module Contents¶

RFM69Serial.device.RFM69_FSTEP = 61.03515625¶
class RFM69Serial.device.Rfm69SerialDevice(address=1, network=101, port='/dev/ttyACM0')¶

Bases: serial.Serial

Serial port implementation for .NET/Mono.

property device_address(self)¶
property network_id(self)¶
property is_encrypted(self)¶
set_dev_address(self, address)¶

Set the address of RFM69 module, default value is 1 Note: it should noted that the device address in this library is currently limited to 254, though the original Arduino RFM69 implement maximum 1024 nodes in a network. The reason is for simplicity. This may be reviewed and improved in the next version ;P

Parameters

address – nominated address of the RFM69 module

Returns

True if the device’s address is set, False otherwise.

set_network_id(self, nid)¶

Set the network ID of RFM69 module, default value is 101

Parameters

nid – nominated network ID, max 255

Returns

True if the device’s network ID is set, False otherwise.

send_msg(self, target_addr, msg, ack_request=False)¶

Send a single message to target device specified by target address. This method covers the send() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Parameters

  • target_addr – the address of receiving Arduino board.

  • msg – message to send, message must be of type string or a list of byte values (0-255).

  • ack_request – acknowledge request status, if True, the request is embedded in the message.

Returns

True if the message is sent, False otherwise.

send_msg_with_retry(self, target_addr, msg, retries=2, time_out=50)¶

Send a single message a number (retries) of times to ensure the message deliverance. This method covers the sendWithRetry() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Parameters

  • target_addr – the address of receiving Arduino board.

  • msg – message to send, message must be of type string or a list of byte values (0-255)

  • retries – number of times the sender attempts to send the message to the receiver.

  • time_out – each attempt waits for “time_out” miliseconds before moving to the next attempt.

Returns

True if the message is sent, False otherwise.

begin_receive(self)¶

Change RFM69 module from TX to RX and wait for message to arrive. This method covers receiveBegin() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Returns

True if state changed, False otherwise.

receive_done(self)¶

Check if there is a newly received message in device’s memory. This method covers receiveDone() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Returns

True if there is a new message, False otherwise.

ACK_received(self, target_addr=2)¶

Check if an acknowledge is embedded in newly received message from the device at target_addr Should be polled immediately after sending a packet with ACK request

ACK_requested(self)¶

Check whether an ACK was requested in the last received packet

send_ACK(self, msg)¶

Send back an acknowledge message to the sender if ACK_requested is detected. Should be called immediately after reception in case sender wants ACK.

Parameters

msg – some message to be sent along with ACK.

Returns

True if ACK is sent, False otherwise.

get_frequency(self)¶

Read the current frequency setting from RFM69 module. This method covers getFrequency() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Returns

current set carrier frequency (in decimal) if read command succeeded. None if failed.

set_frequency(self, freq=915000000)¶

Set the carrier frequency of RFM69 module to a specific value/ This method covers getFrequency() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Parameters

freq – nominated carrier frequency to be set for the RFM69 module (in decimal)

Returns

True if set, False otherwise.

encrypt(self, key='samplekey16bytes')¶

Enable/Disable encryption feature on RFM69 module. This method covers encrypt() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Parameters

key – 16-byte long encryption key to be set for RFM69 module’s AES engine. If the key is set to null string (‘’), the encryption mode is disabled. If no key is provided, the encryption mode is set to be enabled with default key ‘samplekey16bytes’.

Returns

True if the command was acknowledge, False otherwie.

set_chip_select(self, pin=0)¶

Set chip select pin on the serial device. This method covers setCS() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Parameters

pin – nominated dev board’s digital pin for chip select

Returns

True if the pin is set, False otherwise.

set_interrupt_pin(self, pin=0)¶

Set interrupt pin on the serial device. This method covers setIrq() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Parameters

pin – nominated dev board’s digital pin for interrupt function.

Returns

True if the pin is set, False otherwise.

get_rssi(self, force=False)¶

Get signal strength value from RFM69 module. This method covers readRSSI() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Parameters

force – Force trigger state.

Returns

RSSI value in decimal if read command is successful. None otherwise.

set_spy(self, enable=False)¶

Enable RFM69 module promiscuous mode to listen to any packet in the network. This method covers spyMode() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Parameters

enable – bool value to enable/disable the spy mode. default to False.

Returns

True if the command is successful. False otherwise.

set_high_power(self, enable=True)¶
set_power_level(self, level=100)¶
get_power_level(self)¶
sleep(self)¶

Put the RFM69 module into sleep mode.

Returns

True if the module is set to sleep. False otherwise.

read_temperature(self)¶
rc_calibration(self)¶
read_register(self, reg_addr)¶

Read value from configuraton and status registers built-in RFM69 module. This method covers readReg() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Parameters

reg_addr – Register address, it must be of type bytes

Returns

the current value of the register @reg_addr if successful. None if failed.

write_register(self, reg_addr, value)¶

Write value to specific configuraton and status registers built-in RFM69 module. This method covers writeReg() function in RFM69 Arduino library.

Parameters

  • reg_addr – Register address, it must be of type bytes

  • value – specific value to write to register @reg_addr, must be of type bytes

:return True if write command is successful, False otherwise.

get_rx_data(self)¶

Request rx data from the middle man. Note: The first byte of RX data is always the sender ID (address).

Returns

If success, returns a list of data with the very first byte containing sender ID, else, None.

is_device_connected(self)¶

Check if serial device is online and connected.

Returns

True if the serial device is present and connected to PC, False otherwise
